translations: v.[数]排队（queue 的 ing 形式）

phrs.translation: 排队论；研究等待时间的等候理论

sentences.sentence: More importantly, scientists are already queuing for seats on these low-gravity space-flight services so they can collect data during a few minutes of weightlessness.
sentences.translation: 更重要的是，科学家们已经在排队争取这些低重力太空飞行服务的座位了，这样他们就可以在几分钟的失重状态下收集数据。

sentences.sentence: Some cultures are too adept at lining up: a citizen of the former Soviet Union would join a queue just so he could get to the head of that queue and see what everyone was queuing for.
sentences.translation: 有些文化太善于排队了：前苏联的一个公民会加入队列，只是为了他能排在队伍的前头，看看每个人是为了什么而排队。

sentences.sentence: Italian football clubs are queuing up to sign the young star.
sentences.translation: 意大利的足球俱乐部都抢着要与这个年轻球星签约。
